org.exquisite.tests.communication.protocol

Class ServerProtocol

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.exquisite.tests.communication.protocol.ServerProtocol
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    INotifyingThreadListener

    public class ServerProtocol
extends java.lang.Object
implements INotifyingThreadListener
    ServerProtocol manages the conversation between the client and server. Server routes requests from the client to ServerProtocol which in turn generates responses that Server sends back to the client. A static main method has been included to test/demonstrate the flow of data between client and server.

    The conversation can be summarized as follows:

    1. The client issues a POST_MODEL message to prepare ServerProtocol for the incoming data.
    2. ServerProtocol responds OK or ERROR.
    3. If Client gets back an OK then the client should send off its model serialized as XML.
    4. ServerProtocol receives the XML and parses it. If the parse was successful it responds with OK, otherwise ERROR.
    5. Client can then issue a REQUEST_DIAGNOSIS message - which would start a tests.diagnosis.
    6. Client then polls the server repeatedly with a REQUEST_DIAGNOSIS_RESULT message.
    7. Server responds with status code of BUSY while the tests.diagnosis is in progress, then DIAGNOSIS_READY when tests.diagnosis has finished.
    8. When Client receives DIAGNOSIS_READY response, it sends a REQUEST_DIAGNOSIS_RESULT message.
    9. Server sends the results of the tests.diagnosis.
    The client can also send a CANCEL_REQUEST message which causes the server to stop what it is doing and revert to its IDLE state - this is however subject to how the solver is implemented.

    Author:
    David
    See Also:
    Server, INotifyingThreadListener

      • ServerProtocol

        public ServerProtocol()
        When ServerProtocol is instantiated. sessionData is also instantiated in order to use initial defaults in config. sessionData will be overwritten when Client later sends ExquisiteAppXML.
        See Also:
        ExquisiteSession, ExquisiteAppXML

      • processClientInput

        public ExquisiteMessage processClientInput(java.lang.String message)
        Manages the requests coming from and responses going back to the client.
        Parameters:
        message - the message received from the client.
        Returns:
        ExquisiteMessage object containing the response status code and message items to send back to the client.
        See Also:
        ExquisiteMessage, Server

      • notifyOfThreadComplete

        public void notifyOfThreadComplete(NotifyingThread thread)
        An event handler to react when the diagnosisEngine thread has finished.

        If the tests.diagnosis engine ran to completion then the diagnoses list is updated and the state is changed to DIAGNOSIS_READY. If the thread was interrupted (e.g. the client sent a CANCEL_DIAGNOSIS request) then the state is reverted to IDLE.

        Specified by:
        notifyOfThreadComplete in interface INotifyingThreadListener
        Parameters:
        thread - the thread that sent the notification event.

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Runs some tests to demonstrate how ServerProtocol works.
        Parameters:
        args -
